title: Half of top savings accounts have strings attached – here are the best deals that don't
text:
Savers searching for an "easy access" account with a top rate might have to compromise on how often they access their cash, as half of the best deals now have restrictions.

Five of the top 10 easy access accounts have barriers to withdrawing money, with the most common being how often consumers can take their cash out.

Today's best rate, 1.45pc from Virgin Money, has a condition that means customers can withdraw money just twice a year.

A deal paying 1.4pc, from Britannia, allows four withdrawals before the rate drops to 0.3pc for the rest of the calendar year, while Chelsea Building Society will pay 1.4pc but only allows cash to be removed once in 12 months.

Easy access accounts with no restrictions...
description: Savers searching for an "easy access" account with a top rate might have to compromise on how often they access their cash, as half of the best deals now have restrictions.
